column6: Fundamental drawing and studio experiences; exploration of basic drawing ideas and media. Work produced in class must be retained for later portfolio presentation in ARTF 24005.

column4: ARTF 14000.
column6: Continued practice in drawing with particular emphasis upon dimensional representation and pictorial structure. Work produced in this class must be retained for later portfolio presentation in ARTF 24005.
An introduction to the basic concepts of three-dimensional form. Work produced in this course must be retained for later portfolio presentation in ARTF 24005.

column4: ARTF 14000.
column6: Opaque, water based media used to introduce fundamental form language and vocabulary of painting. Emphasis upon structured study and effective use of colors. Work produced in class must be retained for later portfolio presentation in ARTF 24005.

column4: ARTF 14001.
column6: Emphasis on continued development of drawing with focus on nonfigurative representations of pictorial space. Work produced in this course must be retained for later portfolio presentation in ARTF 24005.

column4: ART 10022, ART 10023, ARTF 14000, ARTF 14001, ARTF 14055, ARTF 14060, ARTH 22006, ARTH 22007, ARTF 24010 AND ARTF 24040.
column6: Diagnostic review by fine arts faculty of portfolio of work selected from "foundation" courses. Student's knowledge of art history is also examined. Student must receive a passing score (above average of C) to continue in degree program. Action by faculty committee may include the assignment of additional studio work over the normal graduation Requirements in areas of apparent deficiencies.

column4: ARTF14000 and ARTF14022.
column6: Introductory studio/lecture course which introduces fine art photography with an aesthetic, contemporary approach. Students learn traditional and digital photographic image-making applications and the historical underpinnings of the photograph in modern art. Research paper and portfolio required. Work produced in this class must be retained for later portfolio presentation in ARTF 24005.

column4: ARTF 14000.
column6: Basic traditional and contemporary techniques of relief (woodcut, lino-cut, etc.) And intaglio printing (etching, colography, etc.) Work produced in this class must be retained for later portfolio presentation in ARTF 24005.

column4: ARTF 14055.
column6: Continuation of sculpture I with greater emphasis on materials and processes.

column4: ARTF 14060.
column6: Continuation of work begun in Painting I. Introduction to oil painting with emphasis upon direct painting from observed sources and study of expressive capabilities of painting.

column4: ARTF 24001 and a grade of S in ARTF 24005.
column6: Further study and understanding of concepts and ideas which enable the student to understand and professionally realize their drawings.

column4: ARTF14000, ARTF14001, ARTF 24001 and a grade of S in ARTF 24005.
column6: Extensive studio practice of traditional and contemporary approaches to the human figure. Critical analysis of the figure from the Renaissance through postmodernism. Students work from a nude model.

column4: ARTF 24040 or a grade of S in ARTF 24005.
column6: Continuation of ARTF 24040 emphasizing individually assigned problems in intaglio with introduction to color intaglio techniques.

column4: ARTF 24040 and a grade of S in ARTF 24005.
column6: The initial presentation of fundamental concepts and processes pertaining to serigraphy. This course will include printing techniques and aesthetic considerations in the making of art.

column4: ARTF 24040 and a grade of S in ARTF 24005.
column6: Introduction to stone lithography. Techniques of drawing and printing crayon, tusche, transfer and color images and their relation to problems of drawing and composition.

column4: ARTF 24055 and a grade of S in ARTF 24005.
column6: (Repeatable for a maximum of 6 credit hours) Continuation of the study of the human figure in sculpture.

column4: ARTF 24055 and ARTF 24005 with a grade of S.
column6: A sculpture course with an emphasis on other conceptual approaches beyond the more formal and aesthetic considerations explored in Sculpture II.

column4: ARTF 24060 and a grade of S in ARTF 24005.
column6: Continuation of the painting experience in various media, using formal means of painting expressively.

column4: ARTF 34001 and a grade of S in ARTF 24005.
column6: Continuation of ARTF 34001.

column4: ARTF 24010 and ARTF 24005 with a grade of S.
column6: Combined studio/lecture course offering more advanced, conceptual approaches to the contemporary applications of photographic imaging for artists. Students work with larger scale printing formats, more involved research and greater depth of involvement with the photographic medium.

column4: ARTF 34040 and a grade of S in ARTF 24005.
column6: Continuation of ARTF 34040 with special emphasis on color and photographic techniques intaglio.

column4: ARTF 34041 and a grade of S in ARTF 24005 and special approval.
column6: Continuation of ARTF 34041 emphasizing individually assigned projects.

column4: Choose two (2) from the following: ARTF 34040 or 34041 or 34042 or 44040 or 44041 or 44042.
column6: (Repeatable for a maximum of 9 credit hours) Advanced printmaking course with emphasis on students producing new, individually conceived visual works in printmaking in close consultation with faculty. Written proposal by students required at registration.

column4: ARTF 34055 and a grade of S in ARTF 24005.
column6: Advanced sculpture course with emphasis on students pursuing individually conceived problems in close consultation with faculty. Written proposal by students required at registration.

column4: ARTF 34060 and a grade of S in ARTF 24005.
column6: Advanced painting course with emphasis on students pursuing individually conceived problems in close consultation with faculty. Written proposal by students required at registration.

column2: FIELD EXPERIENCE: TRAVEL STUDY IN FINE ART
column4: Major in Fine Art or special approval of instructor.
column6: (Repeatable for credit)Travel-based study/field experience in fine arts disciplines to and at a site or sites away from Kent State University.

column4: A grade of S in ARTF 24005.
column6: (Repeatable for credit) Special problems in studio art. Discussion, lecture and studio research in various selected media and concepts. Content varies each semester offered.

column4: Major in Fine Art and special approval.
column6: (Repeatable for credit) Additional study in area of student's choice in consultation with advisor.

column4: Senior standing a grade of S in ARTF 24005 and special approval.
column6: (Repeatable for credit) Independently conceived project by senior fine art major, including written proposal and undergraduate thesis, culminating in an exhibition and review.

column4: Graduate standing.
column6: (Repeatable for a maximum of 9 credit hours) Contemporary issues related to visual arts explored through presentation, lecture and discussion. Guest speakers augment staff.

column2: FIELD EXPERIENCE: TRAVEL STUDY IN FINE ART
column4: Graduate standing in Fine Art or special approval by instructor.
column6: (Repeatable for credit) Travel-based study/field experience in fine arts disciplines to and at a site or sites away from Kent State University.

column4: Special approval and graduate standing.
column6: Continued development on a personal direction in printmaking.

column4: Graduate standing.
column6: Continued development of a personal direction in sculpture.

column4: Special approval and graduate standing.
column6: Individual study, painting.

column4: graduate standing in MA or MFA program in fine art.
column6: (Repeatable for credit) Independent study in drawing, painting, printmaking or sculpture. IP Permissible.
